alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Houston; Polk; Trinity; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 6:39PM CST until February 10 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Neches River Near Diboll affecting Houston, Trinity, Polk, Tyler and Angelina Counties. For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto, Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neches River Near Diboll. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding of boat ramps, paths, and trails. Move livestock and equipment to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM CST Sunday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 PM CST Sunday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Friday morning and continue falling to 11.3 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 03/12/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1000 AM CST.
